page.title: 08ELPHINSTONE NATURE TRAIL
page.content: IN ELPHINSTONE THERE IS A NATURE TRAIL. IT STARTS AT THE GRAVEYARD. ON THE WAY TO THE TRAIL THERE IS A GOOD SPOT FOR BIRD WATCHING. YOU CAN SEE GULLS, LAPWINGS, KESTRELS AND A SPARROW HAWK. YOU MAY ALSO SEE FIELD MICE AND RABBITS. THEN YOU WILL COME TO AN OLD RAILWAY WHICH IS LINED WITH TREES ON BOTH SIDES. THE SLEEPERS LOOK LIKE BIG STEPS NOW. THERE WAS A BURN WHICH HAS BEEN FILLED IN TO STOP THE DUMPING OF LITTER BUT PEOPLE STILL DUMP THINGS THERE. YOU THEN WALK ACROSS TOWARDS THE LIE. THERE IS FROGSPAWN IN SPRING. THE CHILDREN IN ELPHINSTONE LOVE TO GO ON WALKS TO SEE THE WILDLIFE. AT ONE TIME THE LIE WAS DRIED UP. NOW IT HAS FILLED UP AGAIN.
